content.webTitle: Folk review: Loudon Wainwright III, Recovery

fields.headline: Folk review: Loudon Wainwright III, Recovery
fields.bodyText: Recovery is, of course, a pun from the dad of Martha and Rufus. Alcoholism ('Drinking Song'), and long-distance touring ('Motel Blues') are there, but it's also all dinosaur-excavated reworkings from his early 1970-73 career. There are great finds - 'Man Who Couldn't Cry' - but some bones are best unpolished. 'Muse Blues' says it: 'Oh muse, where are you?/ I don't know what to do...'
